intro: Thyrsanthema lyrata, commonly known as the lyre's thorn, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, lyre-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. It is often found in sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Thyrsanthema lyrata is adapted to withstand drought and has a relatively slow growth rate.
